page.title: 12EDUCATION WELBURY & DEIGHTON
page.content: Junior School is 6 miles away in Brompton,and after the age of 11 most children move on to the state comprehensive system at Northallerton,one mile past Brompton. Children are collected by school bus each morning from the villages and outlying farms, and returned home between 4-4.30 p.m.After completing their secondary education at 16-18 years,many young people in the area go away to various parts of the country to continue their education at college or university.Children under 5 are taken each morning by their mothers to nursery at Brompton School. In past times the Welbury children attended a local school founded in 1858 by The Church of England, now converted to a private home.Deighton also had its own school,which is now incorporated into a grain merchants.
